comments.creator: virgo@gaiasoft.ee
comments.author: virgo@gaiasoft.ee
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111104165243

Steps to reproduce:

I have several news servers configured in Thunderbird. Ever since upgrading to Thunderbird 8 I cannot read news messages on many servers. In all those cases, newsgroups are selected for offline reading. But there are some servers, where messages are shown. And even, if I simply open newsgroup in Thunderbird and click on message while online, I still have same problem.
Essentialy it shows me blank message preview or message tab. But in the message list it shows at least subject, sender and date from message headers. But when I select message, then I get nothing. Not even a header info is shown. It's just white. 
I did try Repair Folder, but it did not help. I upgraded now to 9.0 beta, but the problem is still same.
One thing I noticed on error console. When selecting  newsgroup with this problem (not all of them have this problem), I get following error on console:
Error: uncaught exception: [Exception... "Component returned failure code: 0x80004001 (NS_ERROR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED) [nsIMsgDBView.numMsgsInView]"  nsresult: "0x80004001 (NS_ERROR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED)"  location: "JS frame :: resource:///modules/dbViewWrapper.js :: DBViewWrapper__applyViewChanges :: line 1388"  data: no]
Message is only shown, when I select newsgroup first time.
And I did try restarting Thunderbird with AddOns  disabled

In all those cases, newsgroups are selected for offline reading. But there are some servers, where messages are shown. And even, if I simply open newsgroup in Thunderbird and click on message while online, I still have same problem.

What happens if you rightclick a feed and choose "get messages"?

comments.text:
Yeah, sorry, I must have misread something.

Can you rightclick on a newsgroup, select Properties and Repair folder? If that feature is available for news.

comments.creator: virgo@gaiasoft.ee
comments.author: virgo@gaiasoft.ee
comments.raw_text:
Only effect, that Repair folder had, was, that for that folder I don't get error on error console anymore. Bu messages are still not shown.
One thing, that I noticed - for the servers with this problem offline message cache files (ones without extension) are missing or empty (Syncronize does not change it). And hostinfo.dat on that server's folder has 
lastgroupdate=0
firstnewdate=0
And also it has a line
newsrcname=servername
But on working servers it is simply
servername

And, when I click "Download now" then Error console shows message:
Error: uncaught exception: [Exception... "Component returned failure code: 0x80004003 (NS_ERROR_INVALID_POINTER) [nsIMsgFolder.downloadAllForOffline]"  nsresult: "0x80004003 (NS_ERROR_INVALID_POINTER)"  location: "JS frame :: chrome://messenger/content/folderProps.js :: onOfflineFolderDownload :: line 370"  data: no]

Additionally. When I refresehd group list on server, then
lastgroupdate got a value and newsrcname disappeared. But it didn't change anything about being able to read messages.

comments.creator: virgo@gaiasoft.ee
comments.author: virgo@gaiasoft.ee
comments.raw_text:
Ok, I found out, what causes the problem. I just don't know, why did it happen and why Thunderbird  didn't produce any error messages. 
There was a line 
user_pref("mail.server.server7.userName", "virgo.parna");
for that server in prefs.js
After removing the line it started working. 
But I still think it as a bug, that it didn't produce any error message.
comments.text:
Ok, I found out, what causes the problem. I just don't know, why did it happen and why Thunderbird  didn't produce any error messages. 
There was a line 
user_pref("mail.server.server7.userName", "virgo.parna");
for that server in prefs.js
After removing the line it started working. 
But I still think it as a bug, that it didn't produce any error message.

comments.raw_text: One of the problematic servers was news.mozdev.org server and it had also same user specified like that. But mozdev requires different username and password. And it was able to update new message count. I just could not read the messages. One thing, that I can think of, is, that all those accounts had e-mail address with virgo.parna username part.
comments.text: One of the problematic servers was news.mozdev.org server and it had also same user specified like that. But mozdev requires different username and password. And it was able to update new message count. I just could not read the messages. One thing, that I can think of, is, that all those accounts had e-mail address with virgo.parna username part.
comments.creator: virgo@gaiasoft.ee
comments.author: virgo@gaiasoft.ee

comments.text: Can you put that userName back and make a log of the session when you try to download messages? See https://wiki.mozilla.org/MailNews:Logging . Enable only NSPR_LOG_MODULES=nntp:5 .
comments.raw_text: Can you put that userName back and make a log of the session when you try to download messages? See https://wiki.mozilla.org/MailNews:Logging . Enable only NSPR_LOG_MODULES=nntp:5 .
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk

comments.raw_text:
Log was created with 
set NSPR_LOG_MODULES=NNTP:5
I could not see anything obvious. I did check announce group, where all the messages were read and downloaded for offline. And no content was shown there either (I was at online mode).

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to :aceman from comment #12)
> Did the bug reappear in this session (i.e. no new messages) ?

Yes, it did. As I mentioned, it also appeared in announce group, where messages had previously been downloaded for offline use. But it also appeared in another group.
